PROPOSED UNIFORM APPLICATION FOR
LICENSE
AS A LEGAL CONSULTANT
Appellate Division, Supreme Court

Judicial Department

Committee on Character and Fitness
APPLICATION FOR LICENSE AS A LEGAL
CONSULTANT
________
________
DIRECTIONS
(Read all these directions carefully before
attempting to answer any question.)
1. This is a statement made under oath. Applicant's failure fully and accurately
to disclose any fact or information called for by any question may result in
the denial of the application, or if applicant shall have been licensed before
the discovery thereof, in the revocation of the applicant's license. 2. Answers must be in BLACK INK, preferably
in typewriting, but may be in applicant's handwriting or hand
printing. 3. Unless otherwise
indicated, every question and every part of each question must be answered, even though the answer be negative. 4. Where "Yes" or "No" suffices, employ that
form in answer. 5. If the applicant
cannot comply with any of the requirements, he must state in detail the efforts
he has made to comply and why he cannot. Answers on information and belief will
be accepted only in connection with matters which the applicant cannot be
expected to remember because of extreme youth or other equally sufficient
reason. All statements made on information and belief must be so designated in
the sworn statement, and the sources of information must be given. 6. Should the space left for any answer be
insufficient, the applicant shall complete his answer on a rider page, specifying the number of the question to which it relates. More than one rider
may occupy a rider page. Each rider should be signed. 7. In stating addresses give street and
number, if any, city, village, county and state or foreign country. 8. In giving a period which is countinuing at
the date of verification of this sworn statement, always give such period as
continuing "to date". ________
TO THE APPELLATE DIVISION OF THE SUPREME COURT
OF THE
STATE OF NEW YORK, ________ JUDICIAL
DEPARTMENT
